Module kopper.tetris
Package kopper.tetris.core

Class TetrisGame.State

  • java.lang.Object
    • kopper.tetris.core.TetrisGame.State
  • Enclosing class:
    TetrisGame
    public static class TetrisGame.State
extends Object
    A Class which represents the state of a TetrisGame. Each of the FOUR states represents a different rendering flow inside of the JPanel's overridden method TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics).

    Note: In future releases I hope to potentially add a FIFTH state, probably titled GAME_ANIMATION, to accommodate some attractive animations during the row deletion process of the Tetris Game. Also, looking into changing this class to an Enum declaration in future releases.

    Author:
    micha

    • Field Detail

      • GAME_START_SCREEN

        public static final int GAME_START_SCREEN

        This is the constant representing the game when it is first started up. During this rendering flow. The following methods are called in order:

        1. TetrisGame.performOneAnimationTick() The internal Timer object triggers this method 25 times per second.
        2. Component.repaint() This is called 25 times per second.
        3. TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called when ever Component.repaint() is called.
        4. TetrisGame.paintGameRunning(Graphics2D, State). This is called whenever TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called. This method paints the running game data represented mostly by BackgroundGrid is always painted on the bottom.
        5. TetrisGame.paintGameStartScreen(Graphics2D). This is always called whenever TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called AND during this State GAME_START_SCREEN=0;. The start screen is painted over the game with a translucent color so that one can see the game screen behind the start screen.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GAME_RUNNING

        public static final int GAME_RUNNING

        This is the constant representing the game when it running and being played. During this rendering flow. The following methods are called in order:

        1. TetrisGame.performOneAnimationTick() The internal Timer object triggers this method 25 times per second.
        2. Component.repaint() This is called 25 times per second.
        3. TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called when ever Component.repaint() is called.
        4. TetrisGame.paintGameRunning(Graphics2D, State). This is called whenever TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called. This method paints the running game data represented mostly by BackgroundGrid is always painted on the bottom.
        5. TetrisGame.performOneAnimationTick(). The internals of this method always execute once for every TetrisGame.TICKS_BETWEEN_GRAVITY times that TetrisGame.performOneAnimationTick() is called AND during this State GAME_RUNNING=1;.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GAME_PAUSED

        public static final int GAME_PAUSED

        This is the constant representing the game when it is paused. During this rendering flow. The following methods are called in order:

        1. TetrisGame.performOneAnimationTick() The internal Timer object triggers this method 25 times per second.
        2. Component.repaint() This is called 25 times per second.
        3. TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called when ever Component.repaint() is called.
        4. TetrisGame.paintGameRunning(Graphics2D, State). This is called whenever TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called. This method paints the running game data represented mostly by BackgroundGrid is always painted on the bottom.
        5. TetrisGame.paintGamePauseScreen(Graphics2D). This is always called whenever TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called AND during this State GAME_PAUSED=2;. The pause screen is painted over the game with a translucent color so that one can see the game screen behind the start screen.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GAME_OVER

        public static final int GAME_OVER

        This is the constant representing the game when it is over and the user has lost. During this rendering flow. The following methods are called in order:

        1. TetrisGame.performOneAnimationTick() The internal Timer object triggers this method 25 times per second.
        2. Component.repaint() This is called 25 times per second.
        3. TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called when ever Component.repaint() is called.
        4. TetrisGame.paintGameRunning(Graphics2D, State). This is called whenever TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called. This method paints the running game data represented mostly by BackgroundGrid is always painted on the bottom.
        5. TetrisGame.paintGameOverScreen(Graphics2D). This is always called whenever TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics) is called AND during this State GAME_OVER=3;. The game over screen is painted over the game with a translucent color so that one can see the game screen behind the start screen.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getCurrentState

        public int getCurrentState()
        Get the current state of this object. One of the four constants representing a game state will be returned: GAME_START_SCREEN,GAME_RUNNING,GAME_PAUSED,GAME_OVER.
        Returns:
        The current state this object is in.

      • isGameRunning

        public boolean isGameRunning()
        Tests this object's current state value to see if it is equal to the GAME_RUNNING constant.
        Returns:
        True if this game's current state is GAME_RUNNING.
